subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Upanishads: Philosophy Behind the Rituals
description: One-minute skill: The Upanishads: Philosophy Behind the Rituals.

hook.text: Forget the gods. Forget the rituals. The Upanishads asked: what is reality? Their answers still stun philosophers.

buildup.text: Written around 800 BCE, the Upanishads shifted Hinduism from ritual sacrifice to philosophical inquiry.

discovery.text: Their core insight: Atman (the self) is Brahman (the universe). You are not separate from the cosmos. You are it.

twist.text: This idea predated Western pantheism by 2,000 years. Schopenhauer called the Upanishads the greatest human thought.

climax.text: The Upanishads prove that philosophy isn't a Greek invention. India was asking the deepest questions long before Athens.

punchline.text: You are the universe, said India 2,800 years ago. The West caught up later.

quiz.question: What is the core teaching of the Upanishads?
